cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

This paper deals with the problem of determining the trade-off between rate and block-length of polar codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the Bhattacharyya parameters, which are commonly used in coding theory and signal processing (cs.SI). The paper uses mathematical analysis and provides lower bounds on a parameter, which is a common approach in theoretical computer science (cs.CC). The paper also deals with the scaling behavior of polar codes, which is a topic in algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the conjecture that the parameter for the binary erasure channel is the optimal value, which is a topic in machine learning and statistics (cs.LG).
